intro: Anthomeles douglasii, commonly known as Douglas's anthomeles, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as along stream banks and in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
